author: Staff Reporter
text:
Private schools which are still waiting for recognition and affiliation from the government should be granted these at the earliest, demanded the Tamil Nadu Nursery, Primary Matriculation Higher Secondary and CBSE Schools Association here on Tuesday.

In a 23-point charter of demands to be submitted to the State government, the Association asked for the affiliation for schools to be extended up to five years instead of three years, as is the norm now.

Process

“Many schools are still waiting for their recognition from the government and the process is cumbersome for them with a lot of procedures involved. Not only should the procedure be simplified, but also be speeded up so that there are more institutions providing quality education,” said K.R. Nandhakumar, State General Secretary of the Association.

He further said that under the Right To Education (RTE) Act, which has been implemented across schools, the government had to settle dues of Rs. 20 crore for the year 2014-15 and Rs. 130 crore for 2015-16.

“The money should be given to the institutions immediately,” Mr. Nandhakumar stated.

Stating that the association wanted to ensure quality education for students, the members asked for the practice of passing all students till class VIII to be stopped to ensure that meritorious students are given more importance.

The association of private schools wants institutions’ affiliation to be extended up to 5 years
title: Speed up process of recognition, demand schools
